entities: International Tribunal for the former Yugoslavia
summary:
The Security Council,

Recalling previous resolutions on the International Tribunal for the former Yugoslavia, 
Noting letters from the Secretary-General, 
Considering the proposal by the President of the International Tribunal,

Decides that the Secretary-General may appoint additional ad litem Judges, 
within existing resources, upon request of the President of the International Tribunal, 
to a maximum of sixteen at any one time, temporarily exceeding the maximum of twelve 
provided under article 12 (1) of the Statute, returning to a maximum of twelve by 31 December 2008.

Decides to remain seized of the matter.
